Quotes: Without culture, and the relative freedom it implies, society, even when perfect, is but a jungle. This is why any authentic creation is a gift to the future.
Author: Albert Camus

Quotes: Culture: the cry of men in face of their destiny.
Author: Albert Camus

Quotes: After your death you will be what you were before your birth.
Author: Arthur Schopenhauer

Quotes: Movies are a fad. Audiences really want to see live actors on a stage.
Author: Charlie Chaplin

Quotes: We're going to shoot one Polaroid per show. I'm going to sign this before it even develops because I know that once it develops with my signature on it, it's worth a fortune. I'll make this a work of magic warlock art.
Author: Charlie Sheen

Quotes: Even in literature and art, no man who bothers about originality will ever be original: whereas if you simply try to tell the truth (without caring twopence how often it has been told before) you will, nine times out of ten, become original without ever having noticed it.
Author: Clive Staples Lewis

Quotes: Personal columnists are jackals and no jackal has been known to live on grass once he had learned about meat - no matter who killed the meat for him.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quotes: Prose is architecture, not interior decoration, and the Baroque is over.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quotes: Cowardice... is almost always simply a lack of ability to suspend functioning of the imagination.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quotes: That terrible mood of depression of whether it's any good or not is what is known as The Artist's Reward.
Author: Ernest Hemingway

Quotes: The job of the artist is always to deepen the mystery.
Author: Francis Bacon

Quotes: Tricks you need to transform something which appears fantastic, unbelievable into something plausible, credible, those I learned from journalism. The key is to tell it straight. It is done by reporters and by country folk.
Author: Gabriel Jose Garcia Marquez

Quotes: Fiction was invented the day Jonas arrived home and told his wife that he was three days late because he had been swallowed by a whale.
Author: Gabriel Jose Garcia Marquez

Quotes: It's easier to replace a dead man than a good picture.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: Which painting in the National Gallery would I save if there was a fire? The one nearest the door of course.
Author: George Bernard Shaw

Quotes: Our words have wings, but fly not where we would.
Author: George Eliot

Quotes: The great enemy of clear language is insincerity. When there is a gap between one's real and one's declared aims, one turns, as it were, instinctively to long words and exhausted idioms, like a cuttlefish squirting out ink.
Author: George Orwell

Quotes: Quote me as saying I was mis-quoted.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quotes: Humor is reason gone mad.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quotes: I didn't like the play, but then I saw it under adverse conditions - the curtain was up.
Author: Groucho Marx

Quotes: Any colour - so long as it's black.
Author: Henry Ford

Quotes: Nothing is more fearful than imagination without taste.
Author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

Quotes: Never pick a fight with people who buy ink by the barrel.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: Words are only painted fire;a look is the fire itself.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: The public is the only critic whose opinion is worth anything at all.
Author: Mark Twain

Quotes: Culture is perishing in overproduction, in an avalanche of words, in the madness of quantity.
Author: Milan Kundera

Quotes: Of all the noises known to man, opera is the most expensive.
Author: Moliere

Quotes: The typewriting machine, when played with expression, is no more annoying than the piano when played by a sister or near relation.
Author: Oscar Wilde

Quotes: The chief enemy of creativity is "good" sense.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quotes: Good artists copy, great artists steal.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quotes: My mother said to me, 'If you are a soldier, you will become a general. If you are a monk, you will become the Pope.' Instead, I was a painter, and became Picasso.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quotes: Sculpture is the best comment that a painter can make on painting.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quotes: I paint objects as I think them, not as I see them.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quotes: Are we to paint what's on the face, what's inside the face, or what's behind it?
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quotes: When you start with a portrait and search for a pure form, a clear volume, through successive eliminations, you arrive inevitably at the egg. Likewise, starting with the egg and following the same process in reverse, one finishes with the portrait.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quotes: Why do two colors, put one next to the other, sing? Can one really explain this? no. Just as one can never learn how to paint.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quotes: What might be taken for a precocious genius is the genius of childhood. When the child grows up, it disappears without a trace. It may happen that this boy will become a real painter some day, or even a great painter. But then he will have to begin everything again, from zero.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quotes: One does a whole painting for one peach and people think just the opposite - that particular peach is but a detail.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quotes: All children are artists. The problem is how to remain an artist once he grows up.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quotes: What is a face, really? Its own photo? Its make-up? Or is it a face as painted by such or such painter? That which is in front? Inside? Behind? And the rest? Doesn't everyone look at himself in his own particular way? Deformations simply do not exist.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quotes: The world today doesn't make sense, so why should I paint pictures that do?
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quotes: Painting is a blind man's profession. He paints not what he sees, but what he feels, what he tells himself about what he has seen.
Author: Pablo Picasso

Quotes: I'd have stopped writing years ago if it were for the money.
Author: Paulo Coelho

Quotes: Libraries raised me.
Author: Ray Bradbury

Quotes: Take care to sell your horse before he dies. The art of life is passing losses on.
Author: Robert Frost

Quotes: Taste cannot be controlled by law.
Author: Thomas Jefferson

Quotes: I put a Phrygian cap on the old dictionary.
Author: Victor Hugo

Quotes: Language is wine upon the lips.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quotes: A masterpiece is something said once and for all, stated, finished, so that it's there complete in the mind, if only at the back.
Author: Virginia Woolf

Quotes: All styles are good except the tiresome kind.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: The public is a ferocious beast;one must either chain it or flee from it.
Author: Voltaire

Quotes: I am not influenced by the techniques or fashions of any other motion picture company.
Author: Walt Disney

Quotes: Disneyland is the star, everything else is in the supporting role.
Author: Walt Disney

Quotes: Animation offers a medium of story telling and visual entertainment which can bring pleasure and information to people of all ages everywhere in the world.
Author: Walt Disney

Quotes: Animation can explain whatever the mind of man can conceive. This facility makes it the most versatile and explicit means of communication yet devised for quick mass appreciation.
Author: Walt Disney

Quotes: He does it with better grace, but I do it more natural.
Author: William Shakespeare

Quotes: I see that the fashion wears out more apparel than the man.
Author: William Shakespeare
